messages.message: never go full retard
messages.author: audiobird

messages.message: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.
messages.author: Steve Martin

messages.message: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?
messages.author: George Carlin

messages.message: You can’t wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
messages.author: Jack London

messages.message: If you’re going to be thinking, you may as well think bigly.
messages.author: Donald Trump, Russian Spy

messages.message: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.message: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
messages.author: A.A. Milne

messages.message: Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.
messages.author: Will Rogers

messages.message: Never put off until tomorrow what you can do the day after tomorrow.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Follow your passion, stay true to yourself, never follow someone else’s path unless you’re in the woods and you’re lost and you see a path then by all means you should follow that.
messages.author: Ellen Degeneres

messages.message: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.
messages.author: Isaac Asimov

messages.message: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
messages.author: Truman Capote

messages.message: People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well, neither does bathing – that’s why we recommend it daily.
messages.author: Zig Ziglar

messages.message: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.
messages.author: Dalai Lama

messages.message: When I hear somebody sigh, ‘Life is hard,’ I am always tempted to ask, ‘Compared to what?’
messages.author: Sydney Harris

messages.message: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.
messages.author: Lily Tomlin

messages.message: Well-behaved women seldom make history.
messages.author: Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

messages.message: If you’re going to be able to look back on something and laugh about it, you might as well laugh about it now.
messages.author: Marie Osmond

messages.message: There are no traffic jams along the extra mile.
messages.author: Roger Staubach

messages.message: ‘I’m bored’ is a useless thing to say. I mean, you live in a great, big, vast world that you’ve seen none percent of. Even the inside of your own mind is endless; it goes on forever, inwardly, do you understand? The fact that you’re alive is amazing, so you don’t get to say ‘I’m bored.’
messages.author: Louis C.K.

messages.message: Life is a blank canvass, and you need to throw all the paint on it you can.
messages.author: Danny Kaye

messages.message: If you hit the target every time it’s too near or too big.
messages.author: Tom Hirshfield

messages.message: If you end up with a boring, miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.
messages.author: Frank Zappa

messages.message: If you don’t design your own life plan, chances are you’ll fall into someone else’s plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Drawing storyboards.
When life gives you lemons, squirt someone in the eye.
messages.author: Cathy Guisewite

messages.message: Don’t worry about the world coming to an end today. It’s already tomorrow in Australia.
messages.author: Charles Schulz

messages.message: I’ll probably never fully become what I wanted to be when I grew up, but that’s probably because I wanted to be a ninja princess.
messages.author: Cassandra Duffy

messages.message: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.
messages.author: Robert Frost

messages.message: My therapist told me the way to achieve true inner peace is to finish what I start. So far I’ve finished two bags of M&Ms and a chocolate cake. I feel better already.
messages.author: Dave Barry

messages.message: Whoever said, ‘It’s not whether you win or lose that counts,’ probably lost.
messages.author: Martina Navratilova

messages.message: I intend to live forever. So far, so good.
messages.author: Steven Wright, not dead yet.

messages.message: If you dream it, you can do it.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: Remember no one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
messages.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

messages.message: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
messages.author: Oprah Winfrey

messages.message: Hope is a waking dream.
messages.author: Aristotle

messages.message: Action is the foundational key to all success.
messages.author: Pablo Picasso

messages.message: Do one thing every day that scares you.
messages.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

messages.message: May you live every day of your life.
messages.author: Jonathan Swift, dead guy.

messages.message: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
messages.author: Woody Allen

messages.message: The best revenge is massive success.
messages.author: Frank Sinatra

messages.message: All you need is love.
messages.author: John Lennon, needed bulletproof vest.

messages.message: There are three kinds of men. The one that learns by reading. The few who learn by observation. The rest of them have to pee on the electric fence for themselves.
messages.author: Will Rogers

messages.message: With great power comes great electricity bill.
Vision without action is daydream. Action without vision is nightmare.
If you make people think they’re thinking, they’ll love you. If you really make them think, they’ll hate you.
messages.author: Don Marquis

messages.message: Leadership consists of nothing but taking responsibility for everything that goes wrong and giving your subordinates credit for everything that goes well.
messages.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

messages.message: The man who smiles when things go wrong has thought of someone to blame it on.
messages.author: Robert Bloch

messages.message: Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.
messages.author: George Carlin

messages.message: No man goes before his time – unless the boss leaves early.
messages.author: Groucho Marx

messages.message: Work is the greatest thing in the world. So we should always save some of it for tomorrow.
messages.author: Don Herold

messages.message: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
messages.author: Confucius

messages.message: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don’t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope.
messages.author: Barrack Obama

messages.message: Smile. Share hugs. Extend love. Unless you are a convicted sex offender.
Remember, you are not trying to create the next Moner Lisa.
Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.
messages.author: Napoleon Hill

messages.message: If you care about what you do and work hard at it, there isn’t anything you can’t do if you want to.
messages.author: Jim Henson

messages.message: Make no little plans; they have no magic to stir men’s blood . . . Make big plans; aim high in hope and work.
messages.author: Daniel Burnham

messages.message: This is the real secret of life — to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
messages.author: Alan Wilson Watts

messages.message: The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.
messages.author: Elbert Hubbard

messages.message: Inspiration usually comes during work rather than before it.
messages.author: Madeleine L’Engle

messages.message: Be regular and orderly in your life, so that you may be violent and original in your work.
messages.author: Gustave Flaubert

messages.message: Getting fired is nature’s way to telling you that you had the wrong job in the first place.
messages.author: Hal Lancaster

messages.message: Work without love is slavery.
messages.author: Mother Teresa

messages.message: If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as Michelangelo painted, or Beethoven played music, or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, here lived a great street–sweeper who did his job well.
messages.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

messages.message: When he worked, he really worked. But when he played, he really PLAYED.
messages.author: Dr. Seuss

messages.message: I’d rather be a failure at something I love than a success at something I hate.
messages.author: George Burns

messages.message: No work is insignificant. All labor that uplifts humanity has dignity and importance and should be undertaken with painstaking excellence.
messages.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

messages.message: All things are difficult before they are easy.
messages.author: Thomas Fuller

messages.message: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
messages.author: Aristotle

messages.message: It has been my observation that most people get ahead during the time that others waste.
messages.author: Henry Ford

messages.message: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
messages.author: Harry Golden

messages.message: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
messages.author: Richard Bach

messages.message: Every noble work is at first impossible.
messages.author: Thomas Carlyle

messages.message: I know you’ve heard it a thousand times before. But it’s true - hard work pays off. If you want to be good, you have to practice, practice, practice. If you don’t love something, then don’t do it.
messages.author: Ray Bradbury

messages.message: The first thing I do in the morning is go to the gym.
messages.author: John Lasseter, Liar

messages.message: The finer the board drawing, the less it leaves for imagination.
Imagine your story. Now imagine if it was good.
There are people that can't see the story in the storyboards. These people tend not to have any imagination. Or maybe you just suck at drawing.
“You see things; and you say, ‘Why?’ But I dream things that never were; and I say, ‘Why not’?”
messages.author: George Bernard Shaw

messages.message: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.message: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Few things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Don't let schooling interfere with your education.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Let us endeavor so to live so that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: A man's character may be learned from the adjectives which he habitually uses in conversation.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Honesty is the best policy when there is money in it.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: I can live for two months on a good compliment.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The human race has one really effective weapon, and that is laughter.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Everything has its limit – iron ore cannot be educated into gold.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It is by the goodness of God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either of them.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: All generalizations are false, including this one.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: A person who won't read has no advantage over one who can't read.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: I am an old man and have known a great many troubles, but most of them never happened.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Denial ain't just a river in Egypt.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It is better to keep your mouth closed and let people think you are a fool than to open it and remove all doubt.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Facts are stubborn, but statistics are more pliable.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: To refuse awards is another way of accepting them with more noise than is normal.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It is easier to stay out than get out.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Wit is the sudden marriage of ideas which, before their union, were not perceived to have any relation.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The very ink with which history is written is merely fluid prejudice.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: When in doubt tell the truth.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Thousands of geniuses live and die undiscovered – either by themselves or by others.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It is better to take what does not belong to you than to let it lie around neglected.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It ain't those parts of the Bible that I can't understand that bother me, it is the parts that I do understand.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The public is the only critic whose opinion is worth anything at all.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The rule is perfect: in all matters of opinion our adversaries are insane.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Prophesy is a good line of business, but it is full of risks.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Do the thing you fear most and the death of fear is certain.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The difference between the almost right word and the right word is really a large matter – 'tis the difference between the lightning–bug and the lightning.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: We have the best government that money can buy.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The main difference between a cat and a lie is that a cat only has nine lives.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Martyrdom covers a multitude of sins.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very'; your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Necessity is the mother of taking chances.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The more things are forbidden, the more popular they become.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Action speaks louder than words but not nearly as often.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Biographies are but the clothes and buttons of the man. The biography of the man himself cannot be written.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: What a wee little part of a person's life are his acts and his words! His real life is led in his head, and is known to none but himself.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: I have been complimented many times and they always embarrass me; I always feel that they have not said enough.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It is better to deserve honors and not have them than to have them and not deserve them.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: There are people who can do all fine and heroic things but one – keep from telling their happiness to the unhappy.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: All emotion is involuntary when genuine.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The trouble ain't that there is too many fools, but that the lightning ain't distributed right.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: I don't like to commit myself about heaven and hell – you see, I have friends in both places.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone, you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: A person with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Many a small thing has been made large by the right kind of advertising.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Familiarity breeds contempt – and children.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Do the right thing. It will gratify some people and astonish the rest.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Loyalty to petrified opinion never yet broke a chain or freed a human soul.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didn't know.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The right word may be effective, but no word was ever as effective as a rightly timed pause.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Patriot: the person who can holler the loudest without knowing what he is hollering about.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It is curious that physical courage should be so common in the world and moral courage so rare.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Never pick a fight with people who buy ink by the barrel.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Life would be infinitely happier if we could only be born at the age of eighty and gradually approach eighteen.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: A man is never more truthful than when he acknowledges himself a liar.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It is just like man's vanity and impertinence to call an animal dumb because it is dumb to his dull perceptions.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: There are several good protections against temptation, but the surest is cowardice.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Let us not be too particular; it is better to have old secondhand diamonds than none at all.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: There are basically two types of people. People who accomplish things, and people who claim to have accomplished things. The first group is less crowded.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: Sometimes too much to drink is barely enough.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: It usually takes me more than three weeks to prepare a good impromptu speech.
messages.author: Mark Twain

messages.message: The saddest thing I can imagine is to get used to luxury.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: To truly laugh, you must be able to take your pain, and play with it!
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: In the end, everything is a gag.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: We all want to help one another. Human beings are like that. We want to live by each other's happiness, not by each other's misery.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Movies are a fad. Audiences really want to see live actors on a stage.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: The hate of men will pass, and dictators die, and the power they took from the people will return to the people. And so long as men die, liberty will never perish.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Remember, you can always stoop and pick up nothing.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: All my pictures are built around the idea of getting in trouble and so giving me the chance to be desperately serious in my attempt to appear as a normal little gentleman.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: I do not have much patience with a thing of beauty that must be explained to be understood. If it does need additional interpretation by someone other than the creator, then I question whether it has fulfilled its purpose.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: We think too much and feel too little.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Nothing is permanent in this wicked world – not even our troubles.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: A tramp, a gentleman, a poet, a dreamer, a lonely fellow, always hopeful of romance and adventure.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: A man's true character comes out when he's drunk.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: I remain just one thing, and one thing only, and that is a clown. It places me on a far higher plane than any politician.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Despair is a narcotic. It lulls the mind into indifference.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Laughter is the tonic, the relief, the surcease for pain.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Man as an individual is a genius. But men in the mass form the headless monster, a great, brutish idiot that goes where prodded.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: I am for people. I can't help it.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: I suppose that's one of the ironies of life doing the wrong thing at the right moment.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: I don't believe that the public knows what it wants; this is the conclusion that I have drawn from my career.
messages.author: Charlie Chaplin

messages.message: Participate. Everything you do is evil to somebody.
Is this a private fight or can anybody get in it?
Hesitation will get you killed.
When quoting someone fallible, just attribute the quote to Abraham Lincoln. I could find no racist jokes in his Twitter feed.

Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: For the past 33 years, I have looked in the mirror every morning and asked myself: 'If today were the last day of my life, would I want to do what I am about to do today?' And whenever the answer has been 'No' for too many days in a row, I know I need to change something.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Creativity is just connecting things. When you ask creative people how they did something, they feel a little guilty because they didn't really do it, they just saw something. It seemed obvious to them after a while. That's because they were able to connect experiences they've had and synthesize new things.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma, which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: I think it's brought the world a lot closer together, and will continue to do that. There are downsides to everything; there are unintended consequences to everything. The most corrosive piece of technology that I've ever seen is called television – but then, again, television, at its best, is magnificent.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Technology is nothing. What's important is that you have a faith in people, that they're basically good and smart, and if you give them tools, they'll do wonderful things with them.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: In most people's vocabularies, design means veneer. It's interior decorating. It's the fabric of the curtains and the sofa. But to me, nothing could be further from the meaning of design.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Older people sit down and ask, 'What is it?' but the boy asks, 'What can I do with it?'.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: You can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future. You have to trust in something – your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever. This approach has never let me down, and it has made all the difference in my life.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: I have a great respect for incremental improvement, and I've done that sort of thing in my life, but I've always been attracted to the more revolutionary changes. I don't know why. Because they're harder. They're much more stressful emotionally. And you usually go through a period where everybody tells you that you've completely failed.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: It's not the tools that you have faith in – tools are just tools. They work, or they don't work. It's people you have faith in or not.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Sometimes when you innovate, you make mistakes. It is best to admit them quickly, and get on with improving your other innovations.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: And no, we don't know where it will lead. We just know there's something much bigger than any of us here.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: It's not a faith in technology. It's faith in people.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: You can't just ask customers what they want and then try to give that to them. By the time you get it built, they'll want something new.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: When you're a carpenter making a beautiful chest of drawers, you're not going to use a piece of plywood on the back, even though it faces the wall and nobody will ever see it. You'll know it's there, so you're going to use a beautiful piece of wood on the back.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: We hire people who want to make the best things in the world.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Things don't have to change the world to be important.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful, that's what matters to me.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: To turn really interesting ideas and fledgling technologies into a company that can continue to innovate for years, it requires a lot of disciplines.
messages.author: Abraham Lincoln

messages.message: I like to reminisce with people I don't know.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I have an existential map. It has 'You are here' written all over it.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: My friend has a baby. I'm recording all the noises he makes so later I can ask him what he meant.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I kept a diary right after I was born. Day 1: Tired from the move. Day 2: Everyone thinks I'm an idiot.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: Only one in four jokes ever works, and I still can't predict what people will laugh at.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I busted a mirror and got seven years bad luck, but my lawyer thinks he can get me five.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I live on a one-way street that's also a dead end. I'm not sure how I got there.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: There's a fine line between fishing and just standing on the shore like an idiot.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: A lot of people are afraid of heights. Not me, I'm afraid of widths.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I was trying to daydream, but my mind kept wandering.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: If one synchronized swimmer drowns, do all the rest have to drown too?
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: Sponges grow in the ocean. That just kills me. I wonder how much deeper the ocean would be if that didn't happen.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: On the other hand, you have different fingers.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: Someone asked me, if I were stranded on a desert island what book would I bring... 'How to Build a Boat.'
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: You can't have everything. Where would you put it?
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: Experience is something you don't get until just after you need it.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: Be nice to your children. After all, they are going to choose your nursing home.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I'm addicted to placebos.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: All those who believe in psychokinesis raise my hand.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: Everywhere is within walking distance if you have the time.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: If it's a penny for your thoughts and you put in your two cents worth, then someone, somewhere is making a penny.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: If Barbie is so popular, why do you have to buy her friends?
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I installed a skylight in my apartment... the people who live above me are furious!
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: A clear conscience is usually the sign of a bad memory.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: Sometimes I wish my first word was 'quote,' so that on my death bed, my last words could be 'end quote.'
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: Babies don't need a vacation, but I still see them at the beach... it pisses me off! I'll go over to a little baby and say 'What are you doing here? You haven't worked a day in your life!'
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: If you can't hear me, it's because I'm in parentheses.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: If you think nobody cares about you, try missing a couple of payments.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: How young can you die of old age?
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I drive way too fast to worry about cholesterol.
messages.author: Steven Wright

messages.message: I believe in being an innovator.Walt Disney
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we're curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: I have no use for people who throw their weight around as celebrities, or for those who fawn over you just because you are famous.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: Movies can and do have tremendous influence in shaping young lives in the realm of entertainment towards the ideals and objectives of normal adulthood.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: I do not like to repeat successes, I like to go on to other things.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: Animation can explain whatever the mind of man can conceive. This facility makes it the most versatile and explicit means of communication yet devised for quick mass appreciation.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: Whenever I go on a ride, I'm always thinking of what's wrong with the thing and how it can be improved.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: Crowded classrooms and half-day sessions are a tragic waste of our greatest national resource – the minds of our children.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: We are not trying to entertain the critics. I'll take my chances with the public.
messages.author: Walt Disney

messages.message: If you even dream of beating me you'd better wake up and apologize.
messages.author: Muhammad Ali

messages.message: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Everything popular is wrong.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Experience is one thing you can't get for nothing.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: I can resist everything except temptation.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Every portrait that is painted with feeling is a portrait of the artist, not of the sitter.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Everybody who is incapable of learning has taken to teaching.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: I am the only person in the world I should like to know thoroughly.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: In America the President reigns for four years, and Journalism governs forever and ever.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: There are only two tragedies in life: one is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Pessimist: One who, when he has the choice of two evils, chooses both.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: I think that God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: In England, an inventor is regarded almost as a crazy man, and in too many instances, invention ends in disappointment and poverty. In America, an inventor is honoured, help is forthcoming, and the exercise of ingenuity, the application of science to the work of man, is there the shortest road to wealth.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Ordinary riches can be stolen; real riches cannot. In your soul are infinitely precious things that cannot be taken from you.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: The difference between literature and journalism is that journalism is unreadable and literature is not read.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: A man can't be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Nothing, indeed, is more dangerous to the young artist than any conception of ideal beauty: he is constantly led by it either into weak prettiness or lifeless abstraction: whereas to touch the ideal at all, you must not strip it of vitality.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: The well bred contradict other people. The wise contradict themselves.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: It is better to have a permanent income than to be fascinating.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: The function of the artist is to invent, not to chronicle.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde

messages.message: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
messages.author: Oscar Wilde
